Inns of Court, the.translation[0].defini: the four law societies and their buildings in London, for students and practising barristers, which an English barrister must belong to. The four societies are Lincoln's Inn, the Inner Temple, the Middle Temple, and Gray's Inn.
Inns of Court, the.translation[1].defini: four societies in London whose members have the right to act as BARRISTERs (=lawyers who can argue cases in the higher courts)
